}} 'Andrew Lloyd Webber, Baron Lloyd-Webber' (born 22 March 1948) is a British
composer and impresario of musical theatre.

Lloyd Webber has achieved great popular success in musical theatre. Several of
his musicals have run for more than a decade both in the West End and on
Broadway. He has composed 13 musicals, a song cycle, a set of variations, two
film scores, and a Latin Requiem Mass. He has also gained a number of honours,
including a knighthood in 1992, Citron, Stephen (2001) [http://books.google-
.co.uk/books?id=AWaZ1LAFAZEC&pg=PA400&dq=lloyd+webber+knighted+1992&hl=en&ei=9Q-
o7TJDMKqHhnQekk6n9Aw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCwQ6AEwAA#v=o-
nepage&q=lloyd%20webber%20knighted%201992&f=false Sondheim and Lloyd-Webber: the
new musical] Oxford University Press US, 2001 followed by a peerage from
Queen Elizabeth II for services to Music, seven Tony Awards, three Grammy
Awards, an Academy Award, fourteen Ivor Novello Awards, seven Olivier Awards, a
Golden Globe Award, and the Kennedy Center Honors in 2006. [http://www.cbsnews.com/2300-207_162-
2224288.html Kennedy Center Honors Pictures] [[CBS News]] [http://www.kennedy-
center.org/explorer/artists/?entity_id=16264&source_type=A Explore the Arts â
The John F.Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts] Kennedy-Center.org

Several of his songs have been widely recorded and were hits outside of their
parent musicals, notably "The Music of the Night" from [[The Phantom of the
Opera (1986 musical)|The Phantom of the Opera]], "I Don't Know How to Love Him"
from [[Jesus Christ Superstar]], "Don't Cry for Me, Argentina" and "You Must
Love Me" from [[Evita (musical)|Evita]], "Any Dream Will Do" from [[Joseph and
the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat]] and "Memory" from [[Cats (musical)|Cats]].

His company, the Really Useful Group, is one of the largest theatre operators in
London. Producers in several parts of the UK have staged productions, including
national tours, of the Lloyd Webber musicals under licence from the Really
Useful Group. Lloyd Webber is also the president of the Arts Educational Schools
London, a prestigious performing arts school located in Chiswick, West London.
categories: Best Song Academy Award winning songwriters
